lead_paragraph: Bruton Smith, the chairman of Speedway Motorsports, confirmed yesterday that he had agreed to buy New Hampshire International Speedway for $340 million from Bob Bahre, the track’s 80-year-old owner, in a deal that should be completed early next year. Smith said he did not have plans for changes at the track. He has expressed a long-standing desire to add a second Nextel Cup race at Las Vegas, one of the six other tracks he owns.
